intro: Timonius sericeus, commonly known as the silky timonius, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, silvery foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
